title: 106_hr4339
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Agriculture Competition Enhancement Act of 2000" and includes a limitation on mergers. Limitation on mergers: It is prohibited for a person buying livestock, poultry, or agricultural commodities for resale to acquire voting securities or assets of another person if the total value exceeds $1 billion and the acquisition reduces competition, impacting prices for producers. SEC. 3. PREMERGER NOTICE REQUIREMENT. The Premerger Notice Requirement under Section 3 mandates that individuals in the business of buying livestock, poultry, or agricultural commodities for resale must file a notification with the Secretary under the Clayton Act. The Secretary is then required to publish the notice in the Federal Register, accept public comments on proposed mergers, and consider these comments during the review process within 30 days of receiving the notification. The Secretary must review proposed acquisitions, assess their effects on prices paid to producers, determine market power implications, and potential for anticompetitive behavior. A report with detailed findings is then prepared. The Secretary conducts a review of proposed acquisitions, analyzing their impact on prices and market power. A report with detailed findings and an economic analysis is then transmitted to the Office of Special Counsel for Agriculture and published in the Federal Register. SEC. 4. ENFORCEMENT PROVISIONS: Clayton Act sections apply to violations of section 2. SEC. 5. SPECIAL COUNSEL FOR AGRICULTURE: Office established for agricultural antitrust issues. SEC. 6. GAO STUDY. The Comptroller General will conduct a study on the Grain Inspection, Packers and Stockyard Administration's need for additional resources to monitor the meat packing industry and disparities in administrative authority. A report will be submitted to Congress within 1 year. SEC. 7. DEFINITIONS.

For this Act:
- "antitrust laws" refers to the definition in the Clayton Act
- "basic agricultural commodity" includes corn, wheat, or soybeans
- "livestock" encompasses cattle, sheep, goats, swine, or equine animals for food production
- "person" is defined as per the Clayton Act
- "poultry" includes chickens, turkeys, ducks, geese, or other domestic fowl for food production
- "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Agriculture.
